questions.e: ACL stands for Access Control List, which is used to filter network traffic based on specified criteria.

questions.q: Which command enables IPv6 routing on a Cisco router?
questions.e: The ipv6 unicast-routing command enables IPv6 routing capabilities on a Cisco router.

questions.q: What is the default violation mode for port security on a Cisco switch?
questions.e: The default violation mode for port security is shutdown, which puts the port in error-disabled state when a violation occurs.

questions.q: Which server is required for WPA2 Enterprise authentication?
questions.e: RADIUS server is required for WPA2 Enterprise authentication to handle user authentication.

questions.q: What is the administrative distance of OSPF?
questions.e: OSPF has an administrative distance of 110, making it more preferred than RIP (120) but less than EIGRP (90).

questions.q: Which protocol defines port-based authentication for LAN access?
questions.e: 802.1x is the IEEE standard that defines port-based network access control.

questions.q: What is the purpose of NAT?
questions.e: NAT (Network Address Translation) translates private IP addresses to public IP addresses for internet communication.

questions.q: Which command allows only SSH access on a router?
questions.e: The command 'transport input ssh' allows only SSH access and disables other methods like Telnet.

questions.q: What is the default queuing method on Cisco routers?
questions.e: FIFO (First-In-First-Out) is the default queuing method where packets are sent in the order they arrive.

questions.q: Which 802.11 standards operate in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands?
questions.e: 802.11n and 802.11ac operate in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequency bands.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the 'ip helper-address' command?
questions.e: The ip helper-address command forwards DHCP requests from clients to a remote DHCP server.

questions.q: Which term describes a backup route with higher administrative distance?
questions.e: A floating static route is configured with higher administrative distance to serve as a backup route.

questions.q: What is the IPv6 prefix for unique local addresses?
questions.e: FD00::/8 is the prefix for IPv6 unique local addresses (ULAs) used for local communications.

questions.q: Which command displays DHCP bindings on a Cisco router?
questions.e: The 'show ip dhcp binding' command displays DHCP lease information including IP addresses and MAC addresses.

questions.q: What is the purpose of STP in a switched network?
questions.e: STP (Spanning Tree Protocol) prevents loops in switched networks by creating a loop-free topology.

subnetting.q: What subnet mask allows 30 usable hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: /27 mask provides 32 addresses total, with 30 usable for hosts

subnetting.q: Given 192.168.1.0/26, what is the broadcast address?
subnetting.e: /26 gives subnets of 64 addresses: 0-63, 64-127, etc. First broadcast is 192.168.1.63

subnetting.q: How many subnets can be created from 10.0.0.0/18?
subnetting.e: Borrowing 10 bits from host portion: 2^10 = 1,024 subnets (but Class A starts with /8, so /18 means 10 bits borrowed)

subnetting.q: What mask creates exactly 2 usable hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: /30 mask provides 4 addresses total, with 2 usable for hosts

subnetting.q: Given 172.16.25.100/22, what is the network address?
subnetting.e: /22 means 4 host bits borrowed. 172.16.24.0 to 172.16.27.255 range

subnetting.q: What is the broadcast address for 192.168.2.60/28?
subnetting.e: /28 creates subnets of 16 addresses. 192.168.2.48-63, so broadcast is .63

subnetting.q: How many usable hosts with mask 255.255.252.0?
What subnet mask for 500 hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: Need 512 total addresses (510 usable), so /23 mask

subnetting.q: Given 210.30.12.0/26, what are the broadcast addresses?
subnetting.e: /26 creates subnets of 64 addresses each, broadcast is last address in each subnet

subnetting.q: How many bits borrowed for mask 255.255.240.0?
subnetting.e: 240 in binary is 11110000, so 4 bits are borrowed from host portion

subnetting.q: What is the first usable IP in subnet 172.16.32.0/19?
subnetting.e: First usable IP is always network address + 1

subnetting.q: How many usable IPs with mask 255.255.255.240?
subnetting.e: /28 mask provides 16 total addresses, minus 2 for network and broadcast

subnetting.q: What subnet mask for exactly 4 subnets from 192.168.20.0/24?
subnetting.e: Need 2 bits for 4 subnets: 2^2 = 4, so /26 mask

subnetting.q: Given 10.10.0.0/16, what mask for 1000 hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: Need 1024 total addresses (1022 usable), so /22 mask

labs.feedback: OSPF neighbors formed, routing table updated!

labs.name: Enable Port Security
labs.scenario: Unauthorized device connected to switch port. Enable port security.
labs.solution:
switchport port-security
switchport port-security maximum 1
switchport port-security violation shutdown
labs.feedback: Port security enabled, unauthorized access blocked!

labs.name: Configure Static Route
labs.scenario: Router cannot reach 10.0.0.0/24 network. Add static route.

labs.name: Enable IPv6 Routing
labs.scenario: Router not forwarding IPv6 traffic. Enable IPv6 capabilities.
labs.feedback: IPv6 routing enabled, IPv6 traffic flowing!

labs.name: Configure Access List
labs.scenario: Block HTTP traffic from 192.168.1.0/24 to web server.
labs.solution:
access-list 101 deny tcp 192.168.1.0 0.0.0.255 any eq 80
access-list 101 permit ip any any
labs.feedback: HTTP traffic blocked, other traffic allowed!

labs.name: Configure VLAN Trunk
labs.scenario: Switch ports need to carry multiple VLANs. Configure trunk port.
labs.solution:
switchport mode trunk
switchport trunk allowed vlan all
labs.feedback: Trunk configured, multiple VLANs can traverse the link!

labs.name: Set Up NAT Overload
labs.scenario: Configure PAT to allow multiple internal hosts to share one public IP.
labs.solution:
access-list 1 permit 192.168.1.0 0.0.0.255
ip nat inside source list 1 interface gigabitethernet0/0 overload
labs.feedback: NAT overload configured, multiple hosts can access internet!

labs.name: Configure SSH Access
labs.scenario: Insecure Telnet access enabled. Configure secure SSH access only.
labs.solution:
ip domain-name example.com
crypto key generate rsa
username admin privilege 15 password cisco
line vty 0 15
transport input ssh
login local
labs.feedback: SSH configured, secure remote access enabled!
